page.title: 17Dartmouth Pottery,Warfleet.
page.content: The Pottery was a brewery & factory until 1946,it has 5 floors,with 20 workers and 4 potters.The clay is from Bovey Tracey,then it goes to Stoke-on- Trent to be treated.3 people fill the moulds,which are made in Slapton,with liquid clay and wait for them to set.Then they pour out the slip,& dry, fire and glaze the pottery shapes.They make about 8000 pieces and pack them in 50-80 crates a day to send them all over the world.We talked to 2 of the workers,they paint and varnish the clay shapes sometimes,as well as tidying up the factory and shop,also they do fettling,which is when they scrape the rough edges off the shapes.When they started working there they were told to take their time and do the job properly.It can be a very stuffy and dusty job.They make vases,{ ornaments,pots and gurgling fish jugs.
